metadata.title: CVE-2019-11324 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: The urllib3 library before 1.24.2 for Python mishandles certain cases wherethe desired set of CA certificates is different from the OS store of CAcertificates, which results in SSL connections succeeding in situationswhere a verification failure is the correct outcome. This is related to useof the ssl_context, ca_certs, or ca_certs_dir argument.

criterions.comment: python-urllib3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
